channel.title: Cooking burning determined?
channel.description: How is the burning of the fish determined. Like what is the odds of a fish burning? I know the level determines it but what else?

item.title: Cooking burning determined?
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

Oh double holds twice the value of an int and you can do decimals. I think you can’t use decimals on a regular int. And server.misc.random(75) - burnpercent > 7 means if the server picks a random number between 1 and 75 and subtracts it from the value of burnpercent and its greater than 7, it sends out the message.

Read full topic

item.title: Cooking burning determined?
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Not really an expert on that kind of java, so you’'d have to ask somone else
ANd if you’re going to add a method for burning your first shrimp, I’d say a player-variable is the easiest way to go

item.title: Cooking burning determined?
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

So something like this?

[code]
case 317: //shrimp
double burnPercent = 2.5 * c.playerLevel[7];

for(int cookChefRange : chefRange) { //have to transfer array to int
if(c.usedOnObjectID == cookChefRange) && (server.misc.random(75) - burnPercent > 75) { //chef range array
sendMessage(“You cooked it fine”);
}else {
sendMessage(“You failed.”);
}
}[/code]

Sorry if its sloppy or crappy i couldn’t think straight. It took me like 10 minutes to write that.

Read full topic

item.title: Cooking burning determined?
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Depends on the actual fish, but you should know you would [u][i]always burn your first shrimps in RS, so if you’re aiming it to look like RS’s.

But also remember that Chef’s Range > Range > Fire.

If you want a good base, I’d say at the target level(ex. 40 for lobster i think), make it like 75%, than go down like 2.5% each time the person levels.

But the actual odds are unknown to me.

Read full topic
